alert.note: Alert for Houghton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 3:02PM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Sturgeon River near Chassell affecting Houghton and Baraga Counties. Trap Rock River near Lake Linden affecting Houghton County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Trap Rock River near Lake Linden. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Water reaches the bottom of the bridge on Cemetery Road creating backwater effects at and upstream of the gauging station * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.3 feet on 06/23/2011. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Friday afternoon at 145 PM EDT.
